column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////The selection of tapas is as robust as it is rich - you will leave here with a food coma if you do it right.  The ambiance is loud and vibrant
column2: just what you would expect from a place serving Spanish food.  Major points because the roof opens up at night in the summer.  Each patron is encouraged to order ~2 tapas so the table has a chance to share and taste everything.  I highly recommend the brussels sprout salad
column4: and the burrata.  My only complaint is that our food came out in small waves with no perceived order and our waitress was snippy/unhelpful when we inquired about the rest of the dishes.
